intro: Trichocereus angelesiae, commonly known as the Angelesia cactus, is a species native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its tall, columnar stems that can reach heights of up to 10 meters. The plant produces striking, large flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming at night. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-draining soil. Due to its unique appearance and growth habits, it is a popular specimen among cactus enthusiasts and botanists.
